intro: Mappia dimorpha, commonly known as the two-form mappia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two forms—determinate and indeterminate—depending on environmental conditions. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals and prominent stamens. Mappia dimorpha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
